at.tugraz.ist.soma.cfg

Class CFGNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.tugraz.ist.soma.cfg.CFGNode

  • public class CFGNode
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents one node of the control flow graph.
    Author:
    Stephan Fr√ºhwirt

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private CFGNode influencedBy 
      private java.util.ArrayList<CFGNode> predecessors 
      private Statement statement 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CFGNode()
      use this constructor if you want to create the start node.
      CFGNode(Statement statement)
      use this constructor if you want to create a new node.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendPredecessor(CFGNode node)
      appends a new node to this node, i.e. a link between this node and a given node (successor or predecessor).
      CFGNode getInfluence()
      returns the node which influences this node.
      java.util.ArrayList<CFGNode> getPredecessors()
      returns the linkages to other nodes.
      Statement getStatement()
      returns the statement of a node.
      Type getType()
      returns the Type of a statement.
      void influencedBy(CFGNode node)
      saves the information if this node is influenced by another one.
      void printPredecessors()
      prints information of this node and of its successor/s or predecessor/s to std. out.

    • Field Detail

      • statement

        private Statement statement

      • predecessors

        private java.util.ArrayList<CFGNode> predecessors

      • influencedBy

        private CFGNode influencedBy

    • Constructor Detail

      • CFGNode

        public CFGNode()
        use this constructor if you want to create the start node. You can recognize the start node via the statement variable which should always be null.

      • CFGNode

        public CFGNode(Statement statement)
        use this constructor if you want to create a new node. If you want to create an entry node you should use the CFGNode() constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • appendPredecessor

        public void appendPredecessor(CFGNode node)
        appends a new node to this node, i.e. a link between this node and a given node (successor or predecessor).
        HINT: think about in which direction you should save the linkages!

      • getPredecessors

        public java.util.ArrayList<CFGNode> getPredecessors()
        returns the linkages to other nodes.

      • influencedBy

        public void influencedBy(CFGNode node)
        saves the information if this node is influenced by another one.
        Parameters:
        node - The node which influences this node, i.e. this node is in the body of an if-, else-, while- or for-statement.

      • getInfluence

        public CFGNode getInfluence()
        returns the node which influences this node.

      • getStatement

        public Statement getStatement()
        returns the statement of a node.

      • getType

        public Type getType()
        returns the Type of a statement. If the statement is null (= start node), the type will be 'Type'.

      • printPredecessors

        public void printPredecessors()
        prints information of this node and of its successor/s or predecessor/s to std. out.
